name: Zombay Island
description:
Controls:

  • press esc to open the menu (good for setting music volume and restarting)
  • Right-click and move the mouse to look
  • Right-click and scroll to zoom in and out
  • some airplane controls require you to press keyboard buttons some need to be clicked with the mouse (left-click) and some need to be left-clicked and dragged

Thinking too much if they could an too little if they should the secret bio laboratory on Zombay Island created a dangerous zombie virus. Everything went out of control when two philosopher monkeys landed in the zombie pen and taught them the ancient technique of T-Posing. Will our protagonists survive and escape the cursed island with shark infested waters?

Zombay Island, exiting action thriller now on VHS.

Game submission for Brackeys Jam 2020.2

Anyway now you have to escape Zombay Island by plane, a Cessna 172 skyhawk to be precise, oh and there are zombies as well. They will be here in about a minute to gently fondle your plane and probably eat your brain afterwards.

I hope for your own sake that you know how to start a plane, cause I ain't tellin' ya'. Good luck!

So I have been playing some flightgear lately and was in the mood to make a flight sim.
Bested my kryptonite the evil Quaternion I was set on a path to glory.
Did you know aerodynamic surfaces are hard to model. Yeah turns out simulators are hard to make for a reason.
Luckily I only make you start the plane. Try to reach the win trigger in the air, its more luck than skill. Enjoy the broken physics! No time to fix them now, I will fix them after the jam or not. Depends on my level of procrastination. Also the Credits don't roll *sigh*, but you only miss out on a few cheesy jokes...

Also I had a minor hart attack, when the WebGl version didn't work. Turns out there is a bug in the new Systeminput, that doesn't return the current mouse. Quick rewrite was needed.

If your stuck completetly here are a few tips:

  • rightclick and drag to turn the camera
  • use scroll to zoom in and out
  • left click and drag control surfaces

Tool Used:

  • Engine: Unity
  • 3D Editor: Blender 2.83
  • 2D Editor: GIMP
  • Music: Fruity Loops
  • Audio Editor: Audacity
  • Human model: MakeHuman
  • Satellite data: Google.com, NASA STRM hightmap
